q: ( D-CA), Nancy Pelosi Debbie Wasserman Schultz ( D-FL) and Sen. Kirsten Gillibrand ( D-NY), were in the room when Nancy Pelosi Gabrielle Giffords raised her eyelids. called it a "girl power" moment. After she heard our voices and the encouragement of[ her husband] Mark[ Kelly] and her parents, she struggled briefly and opened her eyes for the very first time. It was a miracle to witness, says Sen. Kirsten Gillibrand . The strength of political sisters, the love of friends and family, top-notch medical care and Nancy Pelosi Gabrielle Giffords ' obviously strong will to survive made this moment possible.

If AIG, whose reckless behavior resulted in a$ 182 billion taxpayer bailout, prefers to do business in Republican states, then the next time they go bankrupt, I hope they don't ask taxpayers in Vermont and other Democratic-leaning states for another bailout, Senator Sen. Bernie Sanders , a Vermont independent, said today.-- With assistance from John Gittelsohn and Noah Buhayar in New York. Editors: Dan Kraut, William Ahearn To contact the reporters on this story

Idol" is doing just fine without him. Not that the man once known as " Simon Cowell Mean" has actually watched an entire episode of his old series since his exit last season. It's on a different time here in the U.K., Simon Cowell told TODAY show host Matt Lauer during a Tuesday morning interview. "I watched some clips last week to get up to speed, and it looked good." her "brand" with fans. England footballer Ashley, Cheryl Cole , 27, had continued to travel and book hotels under her maiden name. Last night a source close to the X Factor host said: Cheryl Cole considered going back to her maiden name but now she has dismissed the idea. People knew who she was as a Cheryl Cole but she has only become truly famous as Cheryl Cole . yet but seeds have been sown by people like Black Eyed Peas singer Will.i.am and it is important she creates a lasting brand. It would be madness to change back. The Sunday Mirror can also confirm that Simon Cowell has promised her a job as a judge on the US X Factor. He has spent the past few days convincing American producers that she will be a huge success.

Mark Kelly, on Saturday night. The astronaut described the latest progress in his critically injured wife's recovery after the Jan. 8 shooting. "She's making progress every day," Kirsten Gillibrand said. She's using both sides of her body. She's able to breathe on her own. She's able to open her eyes and to show people she understands what she's hearing and seeing. So... it's an extraordinary amount of progress for a woman who sustained such a horrific injury that she did. On Sunday, Gabrielle Giffords ' condition was upgraded to "serious" after successful procedures.
